ygData.subject: RE: Digest Number 171
ygData.msgSnippet: I have not scientifically tested this out yet but from last night, using a thulian claw as the primary it seems that I get the same amount of dual wield as I
ygData.messageBody:
I have not scientifically tested this out yet but from last night, using a
thulian claw as the primary it seems that I get the same amount of dual
wield as I did from a dragoon dirk to a barbed whip. A lot more dmg too.
So I think the secondary does not matter.

Your Friendly Rogue and Bard
Hammerpaw and Syren Wind
Champions of Norrath, The Rathe



-----Original Message-----
From: John Kim [mailto:kim@...]
Sent: Saturday, July 10, 1999 11:50 AM
To: eqbards@onelist.com
Subject: Re: [eqbards] Digest Number 171


From: John Kim <kim@...>

On Sat, 10 Jul 1999, Jason Rochelle wrote:
>
> Now let me get this straight. As i understand it the chance to dual
> wield is checked every time you attack, right? therefore you should
> equip a fast PRIMARY weapon, the speed of the secondary shouldn't have
> anything to do with the chance to Dual, right?

The weapons swing independently of each other. Your primary
swings all the time. Every time the delay on the secondary
expires, a dual wield check is made; if it passes, the
secondary swings as well; if not, then another delay begins.

--
John H. Kim
kim@...
